body.p:
Lancaster Ky
June 20" 1861
P. Swigert Esq.
Sec. Military Board
Dear Sir:

I have organized & drilled a Cavalry Company in this place intended to act as a Home Guard. The men have all taken the oath to support the Constitution of the United States & the State of Ky., before the County Judge, who superintended the election. Please send me a blank form, so that I can apply for arms as a Home Guard. Is it necessary to execute the Bond until we know certainly whether the Board will let us have the arms? Please inform me as to this & also what
description of arms (if any) you have suitable for Cavalry.

Our men are for the Union -- & one thing is certain, Garrard Co. is going to stay in under all circumstances. I know you are troubled with many inquiries -- but I trust you will find time to assist me in this matter -- & probably I can reciprocate in future.

In haste
Yours &c
W. J. Landram
Capt. Garrard Cavalry

Garrard
6
W. J. Landram
Capt Cavalry
Garrard Co
Recd of army 24th June 1861.
